Function Documentation

CI_RESULT CI_Simple_Adjust ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_TCHAR *  szProp,
CI_S32  s32Adjust,
CI_S32 &  s32Value 
) [inline]

Adjusts a property value by adding (or subtracting) an integer.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szPropis the property name.
s32Adjustis the amount to adjust the property by. It will be clamped to min/max bounds.
s32Valueis the resulting value.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or szProp is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_CleanService ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_TCHAR *  szCachePath 
) [inline]

Clean service list and local cache files

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szCachePathis directory path to save cache files
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or szCachePath is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_CloseManager ( CI_VOID *  pHandle) [inline]

Closes the manager instance and releases internal run-time resources.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_CloseSource ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_TCHAR *  szType = NULL,
CI_TCHAR *  szPath = NULL 
) [inline]

Closes the source for the session.

Equivalent to: 

	close
		"exsubtitle" (Filename)
		"exlyric" (Filename)
Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szTypeis the type, e.g. "exsubtitle", to close url, file or device can be NULL.
szPathis the file pathname, can be NULL.
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_CreateManager ( CI_HMODULE  hLib,
CI_VOID **  ppHandle 
) [inline]

Creates a Manager Instance.

Note that several manager instances may be created. This is not recommended for DTV since the device allocators may conflict. For DTV, multiple sessions are recommended for Picture in Picture type applications.

Parameters:
hLibCI_HMODULE pointer returned by CI_Simple_LoadLibrary()
ppHandlea pointer to CI_VOID pointer, which contains the manager instance structure.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EPOINTER if hLib or ppHandle is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_CreateSession ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
DWORD  dwFlags 
) [inline]

Creates a session.

A session is an A/V playback source and player. Multiple sessions can exist per Manager instance, thereby enabling Picture in Picture.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
dwFlags
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle is NULL.
CI_S32 CI_Simple_DestroyManager ( CI_VOID *  pHandle) [inline]

Destroys the Manager Instance.

Returns 0 on success (reference count of the Manager is 0 when it releases.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
Returns:
0 on success.
positive integer reference count if some method still has a pointer to the manager handle.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_DestroySession ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession 
) [inline]

Destroy a session instance.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_EscapeReturnString ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_TCHAR *  szCommand,
CI_TCHAR *  szString,
CI_U32  u32String,
CI_U32 *  pu32Returned = NULL 
) [inline]

Executes a string command to the Cipl Manager.

The return value is a string blob.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szCommandis the command string.
szStringis the return string buffer.
u32Stringis the size of the return string buffer.
pu32Returnedis the length of the return string, not including the NUL character. This may be omitted or set to NULL.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or szCommand is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_EscapeReturnValue ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_TCHAR *  szCommand,
CI_S32 &  s32Value 
) [inline]

Executes a string command to the Cipl Manager.

This is to be used only if the return value is integer. Generally CI_Simple_EscapeReturnString() should be used.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szCommandis the command string.
s32Valueis the return value, converted from the return string.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or szCommand is NULL.

framestep

Parameters:
hLibis the pointer to the library obtained by CI_Simple_LoadLibrary().
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.

CI_RESULT CI_Simple_Get ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_TCHAR *  szProp,
CI_TCHAR *  szString,
CI_U32  u32String,
CI_U32 *  pu32Returned = NULL 
) [inline]

Gets a property string

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szPropis the property name.
szStringis the string buffer.
u32Stringis the size of the string buffer in characters.
pu32Returnedis the length of the string returned, in characters, not including the NUL char. This may be omitted or set to NULL.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or szProp is NULL.

CI_RESULT CI_Simple_GetRange ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_TCHAR *  szProp,
CI_S32 &  s32ValueMin,
CI_S32 &  s32ValueMax,
CI_S32 &  s32ValueDefault 
) [inline]

Gets an integer range associated with the property.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szPropis the property name.
s32ValueMinis the minimum value for the property, set on success.
s32ValueMaxis the maximum value for the property, set on success.
s32ValueDefaultis the default value for the property, set on success.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or szProp is NULL.
CI_HMODULE CI_Simple_LoadLibrary ( ) [inline]

Loads CiplMgr library.

Returns:
CI_HMODULE pointer to library if successful.
NULL if failed.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_LoadPreset ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_U32  dwCountryCode,
CI_U32  dwRegionID 
) [inline]
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_OpenManager ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_U32  u32OpenFlags,
CI_U32  u32EscChar 
) [inline]

Opens the manager instance and allocates some run-time resources. This is required before creating any sessions.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
u32OpenFlagsis typically 0.
u32EscCharis the escape character used for StringBlob communication. It escapes the tab and newline characters. Recommended value is 0x1a.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_OpenSource ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_TCHAR *  szType,
CI_TCHAR *  szPath,
OUT CI_TCHAR *  szReturn = NULL,
CI_U32  ccReturn = 0,
OUT CI_U32 *  pccFilled = NULL 
) [inline]

Opens a source for playback.

Equivalent to: 

 	open
		"device" (Number_Index | UID)		// | "CMMB" | "DVB" | "DTMB" | "ISDBT" | "ATSC" | "DMB" | "DAB"
		"url" (URLname)
		"file" (Filename)
		"exsubtitle" (Filename)
		"exlyric" (Filename)
Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szTypeis the type, e.g. "device" or "url".
szPathis the file pathname or number index, or unique id.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or szType or szPath is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_Pause ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession 
) [inline]

Pauses the source playback.

If timeshifting is operational, it will begin timeshifting.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_Play ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession 
) [inline]

Plays the source for the session.

If opened, some devices require selecting the service. Also, Play can resume after a pause.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_RegisterNotify ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
LPFN_CiplMgrNotifyCallback  pNotifyCB,
CI_VOID *  pContext 
) [inline]

Registers an event notification callback with the Cipl Manager.

Multiple callbacks can be registered.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
pNotifyCBis the notify callback to be used.
pContextis the context returned to the callback when the event occurs, typically a class instance.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or pNotifyCB is NULL.

CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_TCHAR *  szCachePath 
) [inline]

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szCachePathis directory path to save cache files
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or szCachePath is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_Resume ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession 
) [inline]

Resumes after a pause.

This variant is typically used for timeshifting.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_Select ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_TCHAR *  szType,
CI_S32  s32Index 
) [inline]

Selects a subtype or substream.

Equivalent to: 

 	select
	"service" (Number_Index)
	"audio" (Number_Index)
	"subtitle" (Number_Index)
Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szTypeis the type to be selected.
s32Indexis the index or substream.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or szType is NULL.
CI_RESULT CI_Simple_SelectSession ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession 
) [inline]

Selects the default session

Equivalent to: 

 	select session [Name]
Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.

CI_TCHAR *  szBlob,
CI_U32  u32Blob,
CI_U32 *  pu32Returned,
CI_S32  s32Number = -1 
) [inline]

Shows the given (complex) state or property.

Equivalent to:

 	show
		"device" [(Number)]
		"service" [(Number)]
		"servicelogo"[(Number)]
		"program" [(Number)]
		"programpresent" [(Number)]
		"programfollow" [(Number)]
		"programschedule" [(Number)]
		"audio" [(Number)]
		"subtitle" [(Number)]
Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szTypeis the type of state/property.
szBlobis the return string blob.
u32Blobis the size of the return string in characters.
pu32Returnedis the length of the return string blob, not including the NUL character. This may be NULL.
s32Numberis the Number/index.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or szType or szBlob or u32Blob is NULL/0.

CI_TCHAR *  szBlob,
CI_U32  u32Blob,
CI_U32 *  pu32Returned,
CI_S32  s32Id = -1,
CI_TCHAR *  szAddition = NULL 
) [inline]

Shows the given (complex) state or property.

Equivalent to:

show
	"program" [(Service Id) (Additional Str)]
	"programpresent" [(Service Id) (Additional Str)]
	"programfollow" [(Service Id) (Additional Str)]
	"programschedule" [(Service Id) (Additional Str)]
Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szTypeis the type of state/property.
szBlobis the return string blob.
u32Blobis the size of the return string in characters.
pu32Returnedis the length of the return string blob, not including the NUL character. This may be NULL.
s32Idis the Number/index.default is -1
szAdditionis the additional filter condition (date or index) of items next from offset, default is null string
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle or szType or szBlob or u32Blob is NULL/0.

CI_RESULT CI_Simple_StartReScanFrequency ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_S32  s32StartKhz,
CI_S32  s32EndKhz,
CI_S32  s32BandwidthKhz 
) [inline]

Starts a re-scan of a tuner with a DTV frequency range, after this scanning, the result will be merged into old channel list.

In general, you will need to call WaitFor("scan"); to ensure the scan is completed.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
s32StartKhzis the start frequency in Khz (or channel number for ATSC)
s32EndKhzis the end frequency in Khz (or channel number for ATSC)
s32BandwidthKhzis the frequency bandwidth in Khz (ignored for ATSC)
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle is NULL.

CI_RESULT CI_Simple_WaitFor ( CI_VOID *  pHandle,
CI_TCHAR *  szSession,
CI_TCHAR *  szType,
CI_S32  s32Msec = (CI_S32)-1 
) [inline]

Waits for a specific task to complete.

Parameters:
pHandleis the Manager instance created by CI_Simple_CreateManager().
szSessionis the session name, which can be NULL.
szTypeis the type of task, e.g. "devicemanager, "device", or "scan"
dwMsecis the millisecond timeout. If omitted or set to (DWORD)-1, is INFINITE.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if Manager is not opened.
CI_EPENDING if timeout exceeded.
CI_EPOINTER if pHandle is NULL.
